commands.name: az network firewall create
commands.syntax:
az network firewall create --name
                           --resource-group
                           [--allow-active-ftp {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--conf-name]
                           [--count]
                           [--dns-servers]
                           [--enable-dns-proxy {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-explicit-proxy {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-fat-flow-logging {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-pac-file {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-udp-log-optimization {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--firewall-policy]
                           [--http-port]
                           [--https-port {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--location]
                           [--m-conf-name]
                           [--m-public-ip]
                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--pac-file]
                           [--pac-file-port]
                           [--private-ranges]
                           [--public-ip]
                           [--route-server-id]
                           [--sku {AZFW_Hub, AZFW_VNet}]
                           [--tags]
                           [--threat-intel-mode {Alert, Deny, Off}]
                           [--tier {Basic, Premium, Standard}]
                           [--vhub]
                           [--vnet-name]
                           [--zones]
examples: az network firewall create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFirewall --private-ranges 10.0.0.0 10.0.0.0/16 IANAPrivateRanges
az network firewall create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFirewall --sku AZFW_Hub --tier Standard --virtual-hub MyVirtualHub1 --public-ip-count 1
az network firewall create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFirewall --sku AZFW_VNet --tier Basic --vnet-name MyVNet --conf-name MyIpConfig --m-conf-name MyManagementIpConfig --m-public-ip MyPublicIp
az network firewall create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFirewall --sku AZFW_Hub --tier Basic --vhub MyVHub --public-ip-count 2

commands.name: az network firewall delete
commands.syntax:
az network firewall delete [--ids]
                           [--name]
                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--resource-group]
                           [--subscription]

commands.name: az network firewall learned-ip-prefix
commands.summary: Retrieves a list of all IP prefixes that azure firewall has learned to not SNAT.
commands.syntax:
az network firewall learned-ip-prefix [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
examples: az network firewall learned-ip-prefix -g MyResourceGroup -n MyFirewall

commands.name: az network firewall list-fqdn-tags
commands.summary: Gets all the Azure Firewall FQDN Tags in a subscription.

commands.name: az network firewall show
commands.summary: Get the details of an Azure Firewall.

commands.name: az network firewall update
commands.syntax:
az network firewall update [--add]
                           [--allow-active-ftp {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--count]
                           [--dns-servers]
                           [--enable-dns-proxy {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-fat-flow-logging {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--enable-udp-log-optimization {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--firewall-policy]
                           [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--ids]
                           [--name]
                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--private-ranges]
                           [--public-ips]
                           [--remove]
                           [--resource-group]
                           [--route-server-id]
                           [--set]
                           [--subscription]
                           [--tags]
                           [--threat-intel-mode {Alert, Deny, Off}]
                           [--vhub]
                           [--zones]

commands.name: az network firewall wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
